intro: Acianthus scopulus, commonly known as the rock heather, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained, acidic soils. Its small, evergreen leaves are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces clusters of delicate, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. Acianthus scopulus is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
